title: Custom navigation menus
body:
This week I've been looking at how to implement custom menus in Gin. Actually, I started looking at and working on it about three months ago, but then stopped all work on Gin—and coding in general—for reasons I won't go into just now. When I got back to the changes I'd started but abandoned, I continued the implementation but quickly realised it was over-engineered.

### Over-engineering

In Gin, as in many a CMS, there's the concept of *content types*. The bonus is that Gin comes with the ability to create your own content types. Up until now, on Prickly Dev, I've only been using one: the humble *page*. My plan was to alter the application to support two new content types: navigation and navigation-item. I thought it would make sense because they would have their own properties, so it seems logical to normalise them. They would look something like this:

```{
   name: "navigation",
	 label: "Navigation"
}```
